intro: Rauhocereus riosaniensis, commonly known as the Río San Antonio cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a low-growing, sprawling cactus with ribbed stems that are often covered in white or pale blue spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring well-draining soil and minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and cactus enthusiasts alike.
